summary:
Siberia is a huge region in northern Asia, part of Russia. It stretches from the Ural Mountains to the Pacific Ocean and is as big as 13.1 million square kilometers. Despite its size, only about a quarter of Russia's population lives there. The area is known for its cold winters.

Historically, Siberia was conquered by Russia over several centuries, starting in the 16th century. Most people living there are of European descent, but there are also many Asian ethnic groups, including Turkic and Mongolic peoples.
title: Siberia
